Dynamic.dc_description_lang:
[Unmanned cargo spacecraft grounded after fire near launch pad]?
A Japanese unmanned cargo spacecraft will remain on the ground for longer than planned after a fire broke out near the launch pad. 
?
?The Kounotori 8 had been due to lift off from the Tanegashima Space Center in southern Japan at 6:33 a.m. on Wednesday, Japan Time, to deliver supplies to the International Space Station. 
?
?Mitsubishi Heavy Industries says the fire started shortly after 3 a.m. but has since been put out. 
?
?The company has not set a new launch date. It will hold a news conference to give an update on the situation. 
?
?The Kounotori 8 will deliver 5.4 tons of daily supplies, batteries and satellites.
?NHK / FIRE DELAYS SPACECRAFT LAUNCH  KAGOSHIMA  SEPT.11  DUR:2’08”  NAT
?
?WIDE: Spacecraft remaining on launch pad
?WIDE: Fire breaking
?WIDE: Fire-flow work underway
?GV: Presser by Mitsubishi Heavy Industries taking place
